main event: A family in Midwest City, Oklahoma observed a round, white object that resembled the evening star and exhibited swift movement on July 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object turned North and disappeared several times during the observation,There were reports of balloon releases in the area which may explain the sighting,The object was observed to be at an estimated altitude of over 26,000 feet,The report indicated no sound was heard from the object,The observation attracted the family's attention due to the swift movement of the object.
witness description: A family sitting on their front porch.
